column1: Franceville is one of the four largest cities in Gabon
column3: 568 at the 2013 census. It lies on the River Mpassa and at the end of the Trans-Gabon Railway and the N3 road. It grew from a village named Masuku when Pierre Savorgnan de Brazza chose it to resettle former slaves and renamed it Francheville (meaning "city of the freed") in 1880. The city later came to be called Franceville.

column2: 1880. The former name was Masuku. As time went on
column3: it became known as Franceville.Features of the town include St Hilaire's Church (built in 1899)

column6: and a golf course. Its airport is 20 km west

column1: Franceville has a tropical savanna climate (Köppen climate classification Aw). There are a lot of thunderstorms in the city.
